newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Panin Bank gets $65 mln syndicated loan.
newsitem.headline: Panin Bank gets $65 mln syndicated loan.

text.p: Indonesia's medium-sized Panin Bank said on Friday it had secured a $65 million syndicated overseas loan.

"We signed the $65 million syndicated loan last Tuesday in Singapore. The lead arranger is Overseas Chinese Banking Corporation Ltd (OCBC Bank)," Hendrawan D., vice- president of Panin Bank, told Reuters.
Hendrawan said the funds will be used by the bank to increase loans for export-oriented clients and overseas clients.
He also said that the company planned to expand its operations to Singapore.
"We have submitted an application to Singapore authorities to open a Panin representative office," he added.
Shares of the bank were actively traded in mid-afternoon on Friday on what brokers said was linked to reports of the syndicated loan and the bank's expansion plans.
At 0825 GMT, it was up 125 rupiah to 1,550 rupiah on a volume of 3.1 million shares.
